Geocoding usage example

Source: vignettes/geocode.Rmd
geocode.Rmd

Two convenience functions are provided that allows address information to be used as basis for a geocoding lookup that can return coordinates. Let’s say address information is provided for an institution or institute that is not present in the GRID database.

The following example shows how these geocoding functions can be used to look up geocoding information:

library(institutions)
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
library(curl)
#> Using libcurl 7.81.0 with OpenSSL/3.0.2

institutions_download()

# using Nominatim API (Open Street Map)
osm <- 
  geocode_nominatim("Kungliga Tekniska Högskolan") 

if (nrow(osm) > 0) {
  # coordinates etc
  osm %>% glimpse()
  osm %>% select(lat, lon)
}
#> Rows: 1
#> Columns: 24
#> $ place_id                 <int> 182887848
#> $ licence                  <chr> "Data © OpenStreetMap contributors, ODbL 1.0.…
#> $ osm_type                 <chr> "way"
#> $ osm_id                   <int> 317156082
#> $ boundingbox              <list> <"59.3454636", "59.3542387", "18.0623594", "1…
#> $ lat                      <chr> "59.34986645"
#> $ lon                      <chr> "18.07063213298418"
#> $ display_name             <chr> "Kungliga Tekniska högskolan, Surbrunnsgatan,…
#> $ class                    <chr> "amenity"
#> $ type                     <chr> "university"
#> $ importance               <dbl> 0.7991388
#> $ icon                     <chr> "https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/ui/mapic…
#> $ address.amenity          <chr> "Kungliga Tekniska högskolan"
#> $ address.road             <chr> "Surbrunnsgatan"
#> $ address.neighbourhood    <chr> "Lärkstaden"
#> $ address.suburb           <chr> "Östermalm"
#> $ address.city_district    <chr> "Östermalms stadsdelsområde"
#> $ address.city             <chr> "Stockholm"
#> $ address.municipality     <chr> "Stockholms kommun"
#> $ address.county           <chr> "Stockholms län"
#> $ `address.ISO3166-2-lvl4` <chr> "SE-AB"
#> $ address.postcode         <chr> "114 20"
#> $ address.country          <chr> "Sverige"
#> $ address.country_code     <chr> "se"
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   lat         lon              
#>   <chr>       <chr>            
#> 1 59.34986645 18.07063213298418

# using MapQuest API, requires .Renviron with MAPQUEST_API_KEY env set
if (nchar(Sys.getenv("MAPQUEST_API_KEY")) > 0) {
  mq <- 
    geocode_mapquest(
      street = "Kungliga Tekniska Hogskolan",
      zip = "100 44",
      city = "Stockholm") 
  
  # coordinates etc
  mq %>%
    mutate_at(vars(starts_with("admin")), function(x) iconv(x, to = "iso-8859-1")) %>%
    slice(2) %>%  # use only the second result
    glimpse()
  
}
